snippet: The findings suggest that once every five years, Europe is likely to experience “a very hot summer,” up from a probability a decade ago that such events would occur once every 52 years.
abstract: Scientists from Met Office, British weather agency, publish report in journal Nature Climate Change that concludes that human-caused global warming is going to make European summer heat waves 'commonplace' by the 2040s.
lead_paragraph: The findings suggest that once every five years, Europe is likely to experience “a very hot summer,” up from a probability a decade ago that such events would occur once every 52 years.

headline.main: Heat Waves in Europe Will Increase, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Europe May See More Heat Waves
